abstract.t: A Protocol Independent Multicast (PIM) Join message sent by a given node identifies one or more multicast distribution trees that that node wishes to join. Each tree is identified by a multicast group address and a source address, which is possibly a "wild card". Under certain conditions it can be useful, when joining a tree, to specify additional information related to the construction of the tree. However, there is up to now no way to do so. This document describes a modification of the Join message that allows a node to associate attributes with a particular tree. The attributes are encoded in Type-Length-Value format.
